item.title: Loyalty Titles
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

public enum LoyaltyTitle {
    SIR(1000),
    LORD(1000),
    LIONHEART(4000),
    HELLRAISER(8000),
    DESPERADO(10000),
    COUNT(15000),
    OVERLORD(15000),
    DUKE(20000),
    KING(25000),
    BIG_CHEESE(25000),
    BIGWIG(25000),
    WUNDERKIND(50000);

    private final int cost;

    private LoyaltyTitle(final int cost) {
        this.cost = cost;
    }

    public int getCost() {
        return cost;
    }
}

You can add the plaintext names if you want, to remove the need for toTitleCase(name.replaceAll("_", " ").toLowercase());

Read full topic

			c.playerTitle = 1;
			c.sendMessage("Congratulations Your Player Title has now been set to @org@Sir");
			} else {
			c.sendMessage("You don't have enough loyatly points.");
			return;
			}
			break;

item.title: Loyalty Titles
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

[quote=“Get Blitz, post:8, topic:424248”] case 7111: // if (c.loyaltyPoints == 1000) break;

this is what i got so far under the second line i am pretty sure i need to add something that would actually set the the title

EDIt

case 7111: //
			if (c.loyaltyPoints == 1000)
			c.playerTitle = 1;
			else
			c.sendMessage("You Do not have enough Loyalty Points");
			break;

this maybe?[/quote]
You would get an error,

Try this or this.

case 7111: if (c.loyaltyPoints > 999) { c.playerTitle = 1; } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough loyatly points."); } break;

case 7111: if (c.loyaltyPoints > 999) { c.playerTitle = 1; } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough loyatly points."); return; } break;

Read full topic
